item.description:
Hi Folks,

As noted in my previous email, this is one in a series of last meetings, so we'll first go back to the well for our never ending "hard problem". Our esteemed Fred Hapgood will lead the discussion with some thoughts that he will present to us.

For the non-obsessed members: "the hard problem" of consciousness refers to the problem of figuring out why we should sense/feel/experience anything at all, since any objective third person account of our brains only contains data-processing-like steps, not "feel like" steps. It's a deep unsolved problem that goes back to at least Descartes, but naturally we solve it every time we get together ;-). There is a vast literature on it (just Google and ye shall find) but it doesn't take an expert to discuss, just some real "hard" thinking.

We'll meet up in our usual roost: 5th floor conference room at 53 Bay State Road (BU campus)

Hope to see you there!
Sean
item.how_to_find_us: Enter side entrance, some up to 5th floor. It's on the BU campus, so if door is locked, my mobile is 617-981-1646
